parameters.ruleName: Special Use fields of the ACF2 logonid record can grant special privileges that affect ACF2 validation.

User privilege fields determine the privileges that are assigned to ACF2 logonid records. A unique privilege is assigned to a type of role (for example, Security Administrator, Auditor, Account Manager, Group Leader, or Consultant) that controls the action they can perform.

IDs with a value of 0 in the UID parameter of the OMVS segment defines them as superusers. This designation allows them to enter Unix commands that can damage the file system. As a best practice, limit UID(0) to started task procedures such as OMVS Kernel or UNIX daemons and reassign a unique, non-zero UID to real users.

compositeParameters.ruleName: The system-critical resource privileges provide accounts the ability to change security controls and system configurations, access sensitive data, and circumvent monitoring and detection.

Entitlements to z/OS Unix System Services (USS) resources such as BPX.SUPERUSER resource in the FACILITY class enable a user to pass all security checks and results in unauthorized access that can compromise your organization's operating system environment, ESM, and customer data.
